oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Church Street Parade in celebration of the Nashville Vols triumph over the Atlanta Crackers, from the Nashville Times, 1940
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A captioned photo from the Nashville Times (1940), about “Here’s what downtown Nashvillians saw marching down Church Street just before noon today--Manager Gilbert and his victorious Vols returning from a three-game triumph over the Atlanta Crackers. The Vols, playing the Knoxville Smokies at Sulphur Dell this afternoon, in the first local game of the season, were met at Union Station today by a huge crowd of celebrating baseball fans and were led up the street, as shown in the above photograph, by the smart-strutting Tennessee Industrial School Band.” Title supplied by cataloger. Forms part of the Nashville Times newspaper collection. 1 digital photo.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Vols (Baseball team); Atlanta Crackers (Baseball team)
